title: 105_s243
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" and involves the temporary reinstatement of airport and airway trust fund taxes. The fuel tax rates specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to be 4.3 cents per gallon for aviation gasoline after specific dates mentioned in the text. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act specifies tax termination periods for certain fuel taxes, with amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amends sections related to ticket taxes, transfers to the trust fund, and floor stocks taxes on aviation fuel. The amendments specify tax termination periods for certain fuel taxes under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act imposes a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel held before a specified tax-increase date. Liability for the tax and payment methods are outlined by the Secretary. The tax imposed on aviation fuel held before a specified tax-increase date must be paid as prescribed by the Secretary. Definitions for terms like "the Code," "tax-increase date," and "aviation fuel" are provided in this subsection. The tax on aviation fuel held before a tax-increase date must be paid as directed by the Secretary. Exceptions apply for certain uses and amounts of fuel. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury or their delegate. The tax on aviation fuel is exempt for amounts not exceeding 2,000 gallons held by a person who submits required information to the Secretary. Fuel exempt from tax under certain conditions is not considered. Controlled groups are treated as one for tax purposes. For tax purposes, controlled groups are treated as one group. The term "controlled group" is defined as per section 1563 of the Code, with "more than 50 percent" replacing "at least 80 percent" in the definition. Similar principles apply to nonincorporated persons under common control. All applicable laws are to be followed. The amendments made by this section, effective 7 days after enactment, apply to floor stock taxes as if imposed by section 4091 of the Code. Transportation taxes do not apply to tickets purchased before the effective date. Section 9502(b) of the Code is amended to transfer taxes collected during the taxable period regardless of when paid. Any amount received in the Treasury after specified dates shall be treated as received the day before such date. The amendment applies to amounts received after December 31, 1995.
